title: Chandoli National Park
subtitle: A Tranquil Haven of Wildlife and Nature in the Sahyadris
overview: Chandoli National Park, located in the Sahyadri range of Maharashtra, is a lush green sanctuary known for its rich biodiversity, dense forests, and scenic landscapes. Spread across Sangli, Satara, Kolhapur, and Ratnagiri districts, it is part of the Sahyadri Tiger Reserve and offers a serene natural retreat for wildlife enthusiasts.
The park features grasslands, plateaus, rivers, and evergreen forests that support a wide variety of flora and fauna, including tigers, leopards, deer, and numerous bird species.

highlights.title: Rich Wildlife Habitat
highlights.description: Home to tigers, leopards, Indian bison, and over 120 bird species within the Sahyadri Tiger Reserve.

highlights.title: Scenic Sahyadri Terrain
highlights.description: Rolling hills, waterfalls, and lush greenery create a picturesque setting perfect for eco-tourism and trekking.

geography.intro: Chandoli National Park is located in the western part of Maharashtra within the Sahyadri range, forming part of the UNESCO-recognized Western Ghats.

details.label: Location
details.value: Between Sangli, Kolhapur, Satara, and Ratnagiri districts, Maharashtra

details.label: Rivers
details.value: Warna and Morna Rivers flow through the park

climate.description: Chandoli enjoys a pleasant climate year-round, with monsoons bringing lush greenery and winter offering cool, comfortable weather.

seasons.text: Monsoon (June to September): The park comes alive with vibrant greenery and flowing streams.
Winter (October to February): Ideal time for wildlife viewing and nature exploration.

geography.conclusion: Nestled in the Sahyadris, Chandoli’s diverse geography supports rich ecosystems and forms a critical link in the Western Ghats biodiversity corridor.

activities.title: Wildlife Safari
activities.description: Explore the park on guided jeep safaris and witness tigers, leopards, sambar deer, and other wildlife.
info: Safaris are available during morning and evening hours.
Advance booking required through the Forest Department.

activities.title: Trekking & Nature Trails
activities.description: The park offers scenic trekking routes through forests and hilltops.
info: Popular routes include Kandati and Zolambi trails.
Carry essentials like water, binoculars, and proper footwear.

activities.title: Birdwatching & Photography
activities.description: Capture the beauty of nature and its inhabitants, including hornbills, flycatchers, and raptors.
info: Early mornings are best for birdwatching.

attractions.title: Chandoli Waterfalls
attractions.description: Numerous waterfalls and streams dot the park, offering beautiful natural viewpoints.

attractions.title: Prachitgad Fort
attractions.description: An ancient fort within the park that offers panoramic views of the Western Ghats.

attractions.title: Warna Dam
attractions.description: A nearby attraction known for its tranquil backwaters and boating options.

marineLife.intro: As an inland forest reserve, Chandoli National Park does not feature marine life but supports a vibrant terrestrial ecosystem.

items.title: Wildlife
items.description: Home to tigers, Indian bison (gaur), deer, leopards, sloth bears, and wild boars.

items.title: Birds
items.description: Over 120 bird species including Malabar grey hornbill, paradise flycatcher, and jungle fowl.

conclusion: Chandoli is a crucial part of the Sahyadri Tiger Reserve network.
Its diverse fauna and rich forest cover make it a paradise for nature lovers and wildlife photographers.

howToReach.title: By Rail
details: Nearest Railway Station: Sangli (75 km), Karad (85 km).
Regular trains connect from Mumbai, Pune, and Kolhapur.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Accessible via NH4 through Sangli or Karad.
State transport buses and private cabs available from nearby cities.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest Airport: Kolhapur Airport (80 km), Pune Airport (200 km).

gallery.alt: Dense forest trails in Chandoli National Park

bookingTips.description: Best time to visit is from November to February for comfortable weather and better wildlife sightings.
Follow all park regulations and stay within designated safari routes.
Carry reusable bottles and avoid littering to maintain the park’s pristine environment.
